diagnosis.final_diagnosis: Cholecystitis s/p percutaneous cholecystostomy and percutaneous cholecystostomy tube placement
diagnosis.diagnostic_reasoning: The ultrasound findings indicated a distended gallbladder filled with homogeneous sludge, slightly edematous gallbladder wall, and borderline common duct size, which supports the diagnosis of cholecystitis. The patient's history of nausea/vomiting and previous abdominal operations further supports this diagnosis.
